title: Case Study Workshop on Sustainable Chemical Decision-Making

context.prior_knowledge: General chemistry and foundational environmental science knowledge
context.additional_context: This course focuses on strengthening practical problem-solving competencies linked to the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). It enables data analysis and collaboration using digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Students can utilize environmental impact assessment tools for chemical processes with 80% accuracy by analyzing real industrial cases
Learners can create decision-making scenarios applying three or more sustainability metrics (carbon footprint, toxicity reduction rate, energy efficiency)
Participants can compare and evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of case studies, then present improvement plans in a three-step proposal format
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
